Distorted Guitar.description: This is a variation of 20140306_attackloop_120BPM_4/4_Acoustic_Kit_Distorted_loop1 and it is a loop created with the Waldorf Attack VST Drum Synth. The kit used was Acoustic Kit and the loop was created using Cubase 7.5. The following plugins were used to process the signal: AnarchRhythms, StepFilter (2 times used), Guitar Rig 5, Amp Simulater and iZotome Ozone 5. Different variations have different filter settings in the Step Filter. 16 variations are labelled form a till p. Everything is at 120 bpm and measure 4/4. Enjoy!

Distorted Guitar.description: Im sorry I haven’t been uploading lately… I really can’t give a reason as to why i haven’t been uploading any of the teaser kicks lately, nor have i given any download links for the actual xKicks volumes 1 or 2… Ive actually finished xKicks volumes 1 - 6, each containing at least 250 unique Distorted, Hardstyle, Gabber, Obscure, Noisy, Nasty kicks, and I’m about to finish xKicks 7 real soon here. Ill be putting up the download links for xKicks 1 - 6 on my profile page on free sound: http://www.freesound.org/people/ElectroShockNetwork/ Here are various teasers from xKicks 1 - 6 Do you enjoy hearing incredible hard dance kicks? Introducing the latest instalment of the xKicks Series! xKicks Edition 2 brings you 250 new, unique hard dance kicks that will keep you wanting more. Tweak them out with EQs, add effects to them, trim them to your liking, share your tweaked xKicks sounds. Only through the ElectroShockNetwork can you get sounds like this for FREE. xKicks is back with an all-new package featuring 250 Brand new, Unique Hard Dance kicks. xKicks Edition 3 features kicks suitable for Gabber, Hardstyle, Jumpstyle and any other harsh, raw sound. Add EQ, Trim them, Add Effects, Change their Pitch. Nothing is impossible to make now that xKicks has arrived. Native Instruments meets ElectroShockNetwork in the latest instalment of the xKicks Series! Using the incredible “Battery” to unleash the full potential of xKicks, ElectroShockNetwork has never made better raw, Xtreme Kicks. Featuring 250 unique Hard Dance kicks, xKicks Edition 3 will leave you mesmerized and the crowd cheering as wave upon wave of awesomeness crashes over you.

Distorted Guitar.description:
I recorded my acoustic guitar with an old dictaphone and sampled that
directly to my Casio SK-1. Captured it with my computer (M-Audio 24/96)
and processed the file in Soundforge. I gappered the file (adding a lot of silent passages at a certain frequency) and pitched it down. Also added some reverb.
Mixed the file with a distorted version of the file using the cyanide2
plug-in. After that I mixed the file with another file, which I made by
drawing very short waves followed by silence (ticking and clicking
sounds).
What you hear is a distorted mush of flames, flickering in the wind and popping and ticking sounds.
Distorted Guitar.analysis: No descriptors specified. You should indicate which descriptors you want with the 'descriptors' request parameter.

Distorted Guitar.description: This siren-like sound has been synthesised using the Kangas Sound Editor to first create synthesised guitar chords, and then clip the waveform to produce a distorted effect. There is a small stereo time lag(0.025 seconds) between the audio output on the left and right channels (speakers). An XML file corresponding to this sound exists on the web page http://www.kangasound.com/xml/xml-listing.php (labelled "Distorted guitar chord - LOUD!"). The XML file can be imported into the Kangas Sound Editor and subsequently customised (e.g. change of pitch or level of distortion).

Electric Guitar.description:
These sounds are samples taken from our 'Music Based on Final Fantasy' album which will be released on 25th April 2017.

These samples were created using a variety of hardware and software synthesizers and external third party effects. The samples are free for anyone body to use in their own projects.

If you created a great project using these samples we would love for you to drop us a link with the finished product. High quality tracks will be considered for release on the 'Remix' side of the album.

Acoustic Guitar.description:
High E String
The open notes from my acoustic/electric Washburn guitar recorded by plugging directly from the guitar into my computer. I use them in a sampler and stretch the notes from lower to higher and they sound good for arpeggios and power chords but not really for strumming.
